TopicTitle: first time going to the MUN

Articles.Content:
well i just bought the game off steam and i built me a mun rocket (pretty suckish but oh lord dat power!) its first stag had about 6 mainsails ( might have been 6 or so srbs) now heres where it gets interesting

i got my orbit going backwards and i thought "*fluffy bunnies* lets see how far we can go" so it went to the mun and i stranded my kerbals there good thing they install magical teleporters on every kerbal huh?

Edited May 21, 2013 by Cykyrios
edited profanity

well i just bought the game off steam and i built me a mun rocket (pretty suckish but oh lord dat power!) its first stag had about 6 mainsails ( might have been 6 or so srbs) now heres where it gets interesting

i got my orbit going backwards and i thought "*fluffy bunnies* lets see how far we can go" so it went to the mun and i stranded my kerbals there good thing they install magical teleporters on every kerbal huh?

CHEERS!! good job on getting to the mun, a small but outrageously large feat for any starting out player! Next step is to land on the moon without crashing, good luck!

Edited May 21, 2013 by Cykyrios
see above

Congrats on getting to Mun! I still remember my first landing; it's a major milestone.

Dear lord, six mainsails to go to Mun? I think you can get there and back with three LV-T45 and an LV-909. I strongly urge you to focus on smaller, more efficient designs. Otherwise, when you start going farther (Duna, Laythe, Eve), you're going to find you need a rocket the size of a continent.
